com.se_project.controllers

Class UserController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.se_project.controllers.UserController

  • @Controller
public class UserController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements the controller functions that link between the user model and its views.

      • getHomepage

        @RequestMapping(value="/")
public java.lang.String getHomepage()
        Returns:
        HTML page of the main home-page of the web-site

      • get_homepage

        @RequestMapping(value="/user/{user_id}")
public java.lang.String get_homepage(@PathVariable
                                                                               java.lang.String user_id,
                                                                               org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        this function get all the courses that exists in the system and show it in the main page of a user
        Parameters:
        user_id - holds the user id that identifies the user through the system
        Returns:
        HTML page of a user(student or teacher) home-page that shows all the courses that is exists in the system (depends on the type of the user)

      • get_Signin_form

        @RequestMapping(value="/sign_in")
public java.lang.String get_Signin_form(com.se_project.models.User user)
        Parameters:
        user - object of the user who signs in to the web-site
        Returns:
        HTML page contains the login form

      • logout

        @RequestMapping(value="/logout")
public java.lang.String logout()

      • sign_in

        @RequestMapping(value="/sign_in",
                method=POST)
public java.lang.String sign_in(com.se_project.models.User user,
                                                                                                 org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        this function takes the user-name and password from a user to open his account on the web-site
        Parameters:
        user - object of the user who signs in to the web-site
        Returns:
        HTML page of a user home-page or returns the login form again if the entered data is wrong
